description: A fast breakdown of Loanwords: Languages Are Shameless Borrowers for builders.

hook.text: English has borrowed words from over 350 languages. It's the most prolific word thief in linguistic history.

buildup.text: French gave 'government,' Arabic gave 'algebra,' Japanese gave 'tsunami,' Hindi gave 'jungle.'

twist.text: Even languages that resist borrowing can't stop it. French officially bans English words but 'le weekend' persists.

punchline.text: English doesn't borrow words. It mugs other languages in dark alleys.
